intro: Pentaphragma tenuiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered pentaphragma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
